definition: to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: I smile through tears, is the Mona Lisa smile gave me endless strength.
sentences.chinese: 我竟破涕为笑，是蒙娜丽莎的微笑给了我无穷的力量。

sentences.english: When she saw the clowns, her tears gave way to laughter.
sentences.chinese: 当她看到小丑演出时，破涕为笑。

sentences.english: She couldn't refrain from smiling through tears.
When the baby starts to cry the family try all they can to make him smile again.
sentences.chinese: 在家里当孩子哭了我们有什么办法能让他破涕为笑呢？

sentences.english: Burst Chi, the little thief laughs via tears.
I just smile through tears, slightly feeling go.
sentences.chinese: 我才破涕为笑，稍感释怀的。

sentences.english: When she saw the clowns, the little girl's tears gave way to laughter.
sentences.chinese: 哭泣的女孩看到小丑时破涕为笑。

sentences.english: Hearing what I said, she smiled away her tears.
sentences.chinese: 听完我的话，她破涕为笑。

sentences.english: She turned tears into laughter when she saw this.
sentences.chinese: 看到这个，她破涕为笑了。

sentences.english: Here's nothing more beautiful than a smile through tears.
sentences.chinese: 世上最美的，莫过于冲泪水中破涕为笑。

sentences.english: He have got one's wish after, immediately smile through tears.
sentences.chinese: 他见如愿以偿之后，就立刻破涕为笑。

definition: brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
to burst with joy (idiom)/to be over the moon/to be elated
to go from anger to happiness (idiom)
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
lit. like raindrops on a pear blossom (idiom)/fig. tear-stained face of a beauty
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
